revised_title: High-Pressure Melting of Iron: Advances in Experiments and Calculations
tldr: This article presents new experiments and calculations on the high-pressure melting of iron, which is crucial for understanding the Earth's deep interior. The authors derive the melting curve of iron using Gibbs free energy calculations and discuss the effects of various parameters on the melting curve. The results support previous experimental data and provide insights into the thermodynamics of iron under high-pressure conditions.
